alert.note: Alert for Northern Wayne; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Susquehanna and western Wayne Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gibson, or 12 miles east of Montrose, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Ararat, Thompson, Starrucca, Gibson, Orson and Lakeview. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 217 and 219. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
